raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "The representation of the logarithm of the velocity constant versus the square root of the ionic force should be linear.", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "According to the Brønsted-Bjerrum equation, which describes the effect of ionic strength on the rate constant of reactions involving ions, the logarithm of the rate constant (velocity constant) is linearly related to the square root of the ionic strength. This is a well-established principle in physical chemistry and pharmacokinetics."}
